Fungal Forge.name: 真菌熔炉 Fungal Forge
Fungal Forge.reset: 每轮开始时，真菌熔炉会立即重置；若内部仍存在智慧生物，则会立即再次触发。
Fungal Forge.stealthdetails: 这是一个直径15尺的球形真菌，朝向房间内的一面有个5尺直径的圆形开口；真菌内部躺着部分腐烂的人形残骸。

Defile and Pollute.name: 玷污与污染 Defile and Pollute
Defile and Pollute.description:
触发 有智慧活物进入或被置入真菌熔炉、真菌熔炉受到伤害、或解除熔炉的尝试大失败；

效果 真菌熔炉用病态的绿色恶魔能量灌满内部空间，这些能量形如液体与雾气的混合体。位于熔炉内的生物承受 @Damage[5d8[variable],5d8[void]] 点伤害，因为他们的灵魂凋零，血肉腐化，而位于熔炉 20 尺内的生物则暴露于喷发的邪秽能量，仅承受虚能伤害，他们的血肉腐烂——无论哪种情况，受影响生物都必须尝试 @Check[fortitude|dc:41] 豁免。真菌熔炉对内部生物造成的非虚能伤害类型各异：绿色熔炉（D6a）造成寒冷伤害，黄色熔炉（D6b）造成毒素伤害，橙色熔炉（D6c）造成酸蚀伤害，黑色熔炉（D6d）造成电击伤害，紫色熔炉（D6e）造成心灵伤害。恶魔与真菌完全免疫此效果。

绿色： @Damage[5d8[cold],5d8[void]]

黄色： @Damage[5d8[poison],5d8[void]]

橙色： @Damage[5d8[acid],5d8[void]]

黑色： @Damage[5d8[electricity],5d8[void]]

紫色： @Damage[5d8[mental],5d8[void]]

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物承受半数伤害。

失败 生物承受全额伤害。若生物位于真菌熔炉内，还将永久获得 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} 与 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}。

大失败 生物承受双倍伤害。若生物位于真菌熔炉内，还将永久获得 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2} 与 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}。

Spray Sap.name: 喷溅树液 Spray Sap
Spray Sap.description:
Trigger 第二子嗣受到伤害

Effect 一股带血的树液从第二子嗣的伤口中喷溅而出，瞄准第二子嗣所选的30尺内的一只生物。该生物受到 @Damage[10d6[poison]] 毒素伤害 (@Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic] 豁免)，并暴露于腐化树液之下。

Corrupting Sap.name: 腐化树液 Corrupting Sap
Corrupting Sap.description:
一轮中首次有生物暴露于第二子嗣的腐化树液下时，该生物必须尝试一次 @Check[will|dc:44] 的意志豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响，且在1分钟内暂时免疫腐化树液。

成功 侵入性的魔化念头和残忍的冲动在该生物的脑海中涌现，导致该生物在其下一回合结束前处于 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard} 状态。

失败 该生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused} 状态，持续1分钟。

大失败 该生物被第二子嗣控制，持续1分钟。

Second Spawn.name: 第二子嗣 Second Spawn
Second Spawn.publicNotes:
第二子嗣的木质躯体在每次移动时都会发出裂响，仿佛其整个架构都在抗拒这令人憎恶的移动能力。这些第二子嗣由木元素位面的原生树精孕育而成，而其中最为强大的个体——实际上可称为“第一子嗣”——便是毁木者那名为女巫树的可移动堡垒。

裂隙木魔融合了恶魔与木元素的特性，它们的木质身体因木瘤、腐烂和真菌生长而变形。平面学者们一直在争论裂隙木魔应归于哪个类别，但对于裂隙木魔自己来说，问题并不复杂——它们在外层裂隙中比在木元素位面更为自在。

恶魔元素生物

裂隙木魔并非真正的恶魔或元素生物，但它们具备这两种生物的特性。由于它们并非由罪恶灵魂构成，因此缺乏大多数恶魔所具有的典型罪恶易受攻击的弱点，而由于它们拥有类似血液的树液，它们也没有通常元素生物所具有的出血免疫。

其它裂隙木魔

在扭曲棘林中，目前活跃的裂隙木魔仅有裂隙蚀界者和第二子嗣这两种类型，但在外层裂隙中，尤其是在哲哈鲁领域里，还存在着其他种类的裂隙木魔。在那里，人们可能会遭遇嗜血的树桩状生物——碎牙，手持原能魔法的类人生物——荒疫园丁，或是庞大的怖物-致命倒木。

Teratomatous Display.name: 畸胎瘤展示 Teratomatous Display
Teratomatous Display.description:
畸变魔张开中央巨口，展示出一团翻滚的畸胎瘤。目睹这一恶心景象的生物身体会自行发生变化，长出自己的畸胎瘤。30尺弥漫范围内的生物必须尝试 @Check[will|dc:36|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:drained,inflicts:sickened] 意志豁免，之后在 1 分钟内对下一次的畸胎瘤展示暂时免疫。此能力产生的肿瘤在生物不再处于恶心状态时消失。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到 @Damage[3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] 点穿刺伤害，并陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

失败 生物受到 @Damage[6d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] 点穿刺伤害，陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}，并陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。

大失败 生物受到 @Damage[12d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] 点穿刺伤害，陷入恶心2，并陷入流失2。

Imbed Tooth.name: 牙齿嵌入 Imbed Tooth
Imbed Tooth.description: 重击时，畸变魔射出的牙齿会嵌入目标体内并开始钻入，在接下来的3轮内造成 @Damage[3d6[persistent,piercing]] 点持续穿刺伤害。

Mugrisant Qlippoth.name: 畸变魔 Mugrisant Qlippoth
Mugrisant Qlippoth.publicNotes:
畸变魔是外层裂隙中毁灭性变异力量的具象化体现。这种古魔处于永无休止的变异循环之中，赋予了它们永不满足的食欲。尽管畸变魔能从任何肉体中汲取养分，但它们并不需要进食来维持生存。它们更偏爱那些在被吞噬前足够强壮、能稍微抵抗一番的猎物，畸变魔几乎会将这些猎物的身体翻转过来，以大口吞下与它们体型相近的生物。

持续且骇人的转变 CONSTANT, HORRIFIC CHANGE

畸变魔的身体始终处于自我消耗并生成新器官的状态。虽然其中少数新生的身体部位会出现在功能正常的位置，但其余部分都会被吸引至畸变魔中央的生长囊中。这个复合器官位于其最大的巨口之内，用于扭曲被其捕获的生物体。极少数被畸变魔吞噬的生物实际上并不会死亡，而是会在身体、心智和灵魂层面被彻底转化为新的古魔。

Awaken Guardians.name: 唤醒守卫 Awaken Guardians
Awaken Guardians.description:
触发 一个生物对腐化树丛造成伤害，尝试但未能解除它，或在中心团块 10 尺内结束回合。

效果 腐化树丛突然收缩，随即发出一阵刺耳的、如号角般的啸叫，并骰先攻。

Corrupt Grove.name: 腐化树丛 Corrupt Grove
Corrupt Grove.disable: 通过 6 次 @Check[survival|dc:42]（大师）来小心地移除所有吸收扭曲棘林环境能量以获取养分的缠结在一起的真菌团块。或者在树丛中进行三次 @Check[religion|dc:45]（传奇）来让一位圣洁受祝的角色祈祷以驱散维持腐化树丛的邪秽能量。
Corrupt Grove.hazarddescription: 一团散发恶臭的真菌团块位于树丛的中央，能从地面召唤真菌守卫以保护自身。
Corrupt Grove.routine: （1动作，毒素，原能）腐化树丛脉动震颤，随即喷涌出一股 @Template[type:cone|distance:60] 锥形范围剧毒孢子，瞄准区域内入侵生物最密集之处。身处该区域的生物将受到 @Damage[8d6[poison]] 点毒素伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic|traits:poison,primal] 强韧豁免）。
Corrupt Grove.reset: 腐化树丛将在树丛内没有敌人且无生物从凹坑外围试图对树丛造成伤害的1分钟后重置。

Spore Telepathy.name: 孢子心灵感应 Spore Telepathy
Spore Telepathy.description: 裹尸苔藓能通过孢子云灵光与灵光内的任何生物进行心灵感应交流，且交流时使用该生物的母语。

Filament Body.name: 菌丝身躯 Filament Body
Filament Body.description: 裹尸苔藓的身躯虽为实体，但比正常生物要轻且灵活得多。它们能轻松穿过直径小至1寸的开口，且在所有受生物体型影响的效果中，均被视为超小型生物。裹尸苔藓在应对基于风的效果时，其豁免检定的成功度会降低一级。

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
需求 处于拟态状态

60 尺 @Check[will|dc:37]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Sporecloud.name: 孢子云 Sporecloud
Sporecloud.description: 60尺。裹尸苔藓不断释放出一团透明的孢子云；灵光内的生物可通过心灵感应与裹尸苔藓交流。在灵光内结束回合的生物会暴露于灰裹病之下。每当裹尸苔藓暴露于比微风更强的风中时，孢子云的范围会缩小至5尺，直至裹尸苔藓的下一回合结束。

Assume Shape.name: 拟态 Assume Shape
Assume Shape.description: 裹尸苔藓可拟态为其生长的生物的实体遗骸或本轮内其伤害的生物的幽灵形态（且常令人不安地扭曲），持续1分钟。在此形态下，裹尸苔藓的恐怖威压灵光处于启动状态，且其触须攻击会额外造成3d6点心灵伤害，使目标感到被背叛和即将死亡，这种感受破坏着目标的心智。若裹尸苔藓攻击的是其窃取形态的生物，则此心灵伤害增加至5d6点。

Grayshroud.name: 灰裹病 Grayshroud
Grayshroud.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:40]

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{疲乏}（1天）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失1}且疲乏（1天）

阶段3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失2}且疲乏（1天）

阶段4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失3}、疲乏且无法说话（1天）

阶段5 死亡

Shroud Moss.name: 裹尸苔藓 Shroud Moss
Shroud Moss.publicNotes:
裹尸苔藓常常被误认为是幽灵，因为它们呈现出已故生物那闪烁不定、虚无缥缈的痕迹。实际上，裹尸苔藓内部并未保留任何已故生物的痕迹。相反，那看似幽灵的形象，实则是由裹尸苔藓那纤细的触须周围环绕的闪烁孢子云所创造出的幻象。当裹尸苔藓未以窃取的形态进行伪装时，它看起来就像是一团灰绿色的苔藓触须，这些触须能够变换形状，勾勒出生物的基本轮廓，宛如一个独立站立的类人生物神经系统，在原本应是大脑的位置，却是一团缠绕的触须。

灰裹病受害者 GRAYSHROUD SUFFERERS

那些感染了灰裹病的人，起初可能只会以为自己只是过度劳累或睡眠不足。然而，一旦被这种疾病耗尽精力，他们的皮肤会逐渐变得灰白，布满片状鳞屑，宛如剥落的树皮。那些因灰裹病而死的人，会如常进入来世，但他们的遗体会催生出一团新的裹尸苔藓，这团裹尸苔藓会将他们的形态纳入自己窃取的形态之中。

Quick Capture.description:
Trigger 一个生物命中或触碰捕蝇草。

Effect 捕蝇草对触发此能力的生物进行一次叶荚打击，如果命中，则该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed}于叶荚。
Quick Capture.name: 快速捕获 Quick Capture

Hungry Flurry.name: 饥饿猛击 Hungry Flurry
Hungry Flurry.description: 巨捕蝇草针对不同目标以-2减值进行四次叶荚打击。这些攻击计算巨捕蝇草的多重攻击减值，但是在攻击结束之后才会生效。

Focused Assault.name: 集中攻击 Focused Assault
Focused Assault.description: 巨捕蝇草用四对叶荚攻击同一目标。巨捕蝇草进行一次叶荚打击。一旦成功命中，巨捕蝇草造成一次叶荚打击的伤害，并且除了第一对叶荚外，每多一个叶荚就能造成额外[[/r {1d8}]]{1d8 damage} 伤害。即使攻击失败，巨捕蝇草仍然能造成一次叶荚伤害。大失败则不造成伤害。此能力计算巨捕蝇草的多重攻击减值，次数等于巨捕蝇草的叶荚数。

Greater Infestation.name: 高等感染 Greater Infestation
Greater Infestation.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[2d8[poison]]伤害（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[3d8[persistent,poison]] 伤害，并能以模糊感官的形式倾听30尺内根腐者的思维（2轮）

阶段3 与阶段2相同，但造成@Damage[4d8[persistent,poison]] 伤害，死亡时转化为根腐者（2轮）

此能力取代了巨型捕蝇草的擒获与活吞能力。

Fungal Flytrap.name: 真菌捕蝇草 Fungal Flytrap
Fungal Flytrap.publicNotes:
巨捕蝇草能很好地融入周围的树林中，它们可以快速打击毫无戒心的冒险者和森林域行者，给他们带来“惊喜”。

捕蝇草能捕食巨大的昆虫、类人生物和其他大型猎物。

Sewer Pipe Trap.name: 下水道管道陷阱 Sewer Pipe Trap
Sewer Pipe Trap.disable: 在金属板掉落之前对地面上的板子进行@Check[thievery|dc:32]（专家）检定。
Sewer Pipe Trap.hazarddescription: 地面上的压力板连接着一块金属板，该金属板用于封住顶端的一些污水管道。

Filth Fall.name: 污秽倾泻 Filth Fall
Filth Fall.description:
触发 对地板砖施加压力；

效果 上方的金属板松动，向压力板周围 10 尺内的所有生物释放一股污水和食肉蠕虫洪流。任何被污秽击中的生物都必须尝试通过 @Check[fortitude|dc:32] 豁免。

大成功 生物未受影响。

成功 生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}，并受到 @Damage[2d12[piercing]] 的穿刺伤害。

失败 生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}，并受到 @Damage[4d12[piercing]] 的穿刺伤害。

大失败 生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 4}，并受到 @Damage[4d12[piercing]] 的穿刺伤害，加上 @Damage[2d12[persistent,piercing]] 的持续穿刺伤害。

Miastrilek.name: 秽肉魔 Miastrilek
Miastrilek.publicNotes:
秽肉魔在真身形态下呈现出类似蜘蛛的外貌。然而，它们在与凡间生物互动时更偏爱类人形态，伪装成富有或有影响力的角色，例如贵族、商人或犯罪组织的头目。

肉体腐化者

秽肉魔是与污染和腐化相关的恶魔，但与泥魔（一种从生前经常玷污和污染周围环境的灵魂中诞生的恶魔）不同，秽肉魔的罪孽更侧重于肉体的污染和腐化——例如，那些在生前在社会中编织复杂的腐败网络，制造并分销摧毁社区的毒品，或利用污染和毒素折磨并改造受害者的人。

Clarity Vulnerability.description: 每轮中，当秽肉魔 30 尺范围内有生物对毒素或疾病进行豁免检定并掷出大成功，或通过魔法或其他效果完全从此类疾病或毒素中恢复时，该恶魔将受到 @Damage[6d6[mental]] 伤害。
Clarity Vulnerability.name: 明净易伤 Clarity Vulnerability

Change Shape.name: 变形 Change Shape
Change Shape.description: 秽肉魔可以变成任何小型或中型类人生物的外形。这不会改变其速度，但会使其无法进行毒牙打击。

Spew Pollution.name: 喷吐污染 Spew Pollution
Spew Pollution.description: 秽肉魔喷吐出一股酸液和碎石的锥形喷雾，对30尺锥形范围内的所有生物造成 @Damage[6d6[piercing],6d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{6d6点穿刺伤害和6d6点酸蚀伤害}（@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] ）。该区域在1分钟内变为有害地形（造成 @Damage[2d6[acid]] 点酸蚀伤害）。每回合中，生物只能受到一次此伤害。秽肉魔必须等待 [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spew Pollution]]{1d4轮} 后才能再次使用喷吐污染。

Tremortoxin.name: 震颤毒素 Tremortoxin
Tremortoxin.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段 1 所有速度受到10尺状态减值（1轮）

阶段 2 所有速度10尺状态减值，且对攻击骰和需要紧握手中物品的检定施加 -1 环境减值（1轮）

阶段 3 与

阶段 2 相同，但检定的环境减值增加至 -2（1轮）

Counterspell.name: 法术反制 Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
触发 一个生物施放了德尔瓦尼斯知晓的法术

效果 德尔瓦尼斯消耗一个同环法术位然后尝试反制触发法术，检定加值为 [[/gmr 1d20+18 #Counteract]]{+18} .

Otherworldly Will.description: 德尔瓦尼斯被一种独特而超凡的意志所驱使，指引其动作。每当德尔瓦尼斯针对一种试图控制或支配其动作的心灵效果进行意志豁免检定时，其检定结果的成功度提升一级.
Otherworldly Will.name: 异界意志 Otherworldly Will

Unexplained Demise.name: 不明死亡 Unexplained Demise
Unexplained Demise.description:
触发 德尔瓦尼斯被生擒

效果 鲜血从德尔瓦尼斯的耳朵和鼻子中涌出，他当场倒地身亡。目睹这一不明死亡的相邻PC必须通过@Check[will|dc:27]豁免，否则会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

Razmir's Disappointment.name: 拉兹密尔的失望 Razmir's Disappointment
Razmir's Disappointment.description: 德尔瓦尼斯在佩戴面具时，近战打击会额外造成@Damage[4d6[mental]]点心灵伤害。如果此类攻击造成重击，被击中的生物会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

Steady Spellcasting.name: 稳定施法 Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: 若一个反应动作将要打断德尔瓦尼斯的施法动作，他尝试一次@Check[flat|dc:15]的纯骰检定。成功时，他的动作不会被打断.

equipment-Black Razmir Robes.name: 黑色拉兹密尔长袍 Black Razmir Robes

Fungal Colony.name: 真菌菌落 Fungal Colony
Fungal Colony.reset: 真菌菌落爆发 24 小时后，该危害将重新激活并可能再次触发。若战殁巨虫已被激活并被摧毁，则在后续的触发中它们不会再出现.
Fungal Colony.disable: 两次@Check[nature|dc:45] 检定，向仍徘徊在该区域的自然世界精魂祈求，请求它们中和菌落的侵染。四次@Check[survival|dc:39]检定以小心地破开菌落中的四棵关键树的树干，使孢子无害地排出。或者@Check[thievery|dc:48]触发原木间的连锁反应，迫使危害以剧烈但无害的方式内爆。一旦危害被触发，仅可通过自然检定解除.
Fungal Colony.hazarddescription: 一圈覆盖着干枯真菌的枯树突然剧烈摇晃并发出嘎吱声，仿佛其中一些树内的某些东西即将爆发.
Fungal Colony.routine:
（1动作；毒素，原能）高达120尺的孢子柱变得具有毒性。每一轮，孢子云的最顶端会下降 40 尺，同时从A2处的初始边界开始，地面部分向外扩展20尺，高度向增加10尺。到第三轮结束时，孢子云会稳定成一个高度为10尺、宽度为45尺的环状结构，轻松填满整个空地。此孢子云不会遮蔽视线，但任何在其内结束回合的生物将受到@Damage[5d6[poison]]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic]豁免）。

到第四轮时，孢子云会随着陷阱的动作沉降到地面。如果陷阱尚未被解除，A1和A2区域之间的地面会爆发，三只长满真菌的战誓者从地面升起，战誓者的身体由古老的精灵骨架与闪光的霉丝编织而成，开始攻击所有进入该区域的入侵者。此时陷阱失效，但战誓者会继续战斗，直到被摧毁为止。

Fungal Eruption.name: 真菌喷发 Fungal Eruption
Fungal Eruption.description:
触发 小型或更大的生物进入危害的环形区域，或试图在低于120尺的高度飞越该区域。

效果 倒伏的树木环向上爆炸至120尺高度。菌落范围内或其上方120 尺区域内的所有生物将受到@Damage[8d6[piercing]]点穿刺伤害，并必须进行@Check[reflex|dc:41]反射豁免检定。随后，真菌菌落将骰先攻。

大成功：目标不受影响。

成功：目标受到一半伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

失败：目标受到全额伤害，陷入恶心1，且因孢子附着在身体上并迅速生长成坚硬、相互锁定的板状物，导致陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} 一分钟。生物可尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape}（DC 41）以提前结束缓慢1的效果。

大失败：目标受到双倍伤害，并被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}，身体几乎完全被坚硬的真菌外壳包裹，直到其尝试逃脱（DC 41）。逃脱后，目标仍会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 slowed 1}一分钟，直到其再次成功逃脱。

Signature Spells.name: 标志性法术 Signature Spells
Signature Spells.description: 阿扎瑞斯可通过消耗对应环级的法术位，以更高环施展@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.oUDNCArkQTdhllxD], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xxWhyl81w3ckslAU], and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kHyjQbibRGPNCixx].

Snowcaster's Legacy.name: 雪术师遗产 Snowcaster's Legacy
Snowcaster's Legacy.description: 当阿扎瑞斯通过打击造成伤害时，会额外造成2d6寒冷伤害，因冰晶碎片与凛冽寒风会挥砍并冲击受打击的生物。

Frozen Bloodline.name: 冰冻血统 Frozen Bloodline
Frozen Bloodline.description: 阿扎瑞斯的术士血统与水元素紧密相连——尤其是其以冰或雪形态展现的形式。当他施展造成寒冷伤害的法术时，目标会额外承受每法术环级1点寒冷伤害.

equipment-Razmir mask and robes.name: 拉兹密尔面具与长袍 Razmir mask and robes

Masked Lies.name: 面具谎言 Masked Lies
Masked Lies.description: 只要阿扎瑞斯佩戴着拉兹密尔面具，就极难分辨他是否在说谎。所有试图识破其欺骗的察觉检定均会因面具而承受-4环境减值.

Skilled Diplomat.name: 娴熟外交官 Skilled Diplomat
Skilled Diplomat.description: 当阿扎瑞斯尝试通过交涉技能进行@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{建立印象 Make an Impression} （Make an Impression）时，他可同时对最多50个生物的意志DC进行检定。若他专注于对单一目标进行建立印象，则将成功视为大成功。最后，当他提出请求时，只要目标对其态度并非敌对，他可将目标的态度视为比当前高一级.

Quickened Casting.name: 快速施法 Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
频率 每日一次；

效果 阿扎瑞斯可更高效地施放法术。若他的下一动作是施放戏法或4环及以下法术，则施展该法术所需动作数-1（最少1动作）。

Drain Soul.name: 灵魂汲取 Drain Soul
Drain Soul.description:
哲哈鲁之嗣伸出汲取茎蔓，从相邻的被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained} 或无助的生物身上汲取灵魂与生命。目标受到@Damage[10d6[spirit]]伤害，并必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:45]豁免。若灵魂汲取造成的伤害使生物的生命值降至0，则该生物会立即死亡。

大成功：目标不受伤害。

成功：目标受到一半伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。

失败：目标受到全额伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}。若目标已处于流失状态，则其流失状态值增加1，最高可达@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 4}。

大失败：同失败相同，但伤害加倍，且目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。

Scent Purity.name: 纯洁嗅觉 Scent Purity
Scent Purity.description: 哲哈鲁之嗣能以作为精准感官的嗅觉在120尺范围内探测圣洁生物.

Grasping Strands.name: 抓握触须 Grasping Strands
Grasping Strands.description:
触发 在哲哈鲁之嗣60尺范围内，有生物使用移动动作或在移动动作中离开一个方格；

效果 一簇触须猛然伸出，使哲哈鲁之嗣能尝试进行一次运动检定以@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{擒拿 Grapple}触发此效果的生物。若该生物在下一回合仍保持被擒拿状态，则可对该生物进行拉拽。

Hallucinatory Spores.name: 致幻孢子 Hallucinatory Spores
Hallucinatory Spores.description: 60尺。哲哈鲁之嗣周围环绕着能操纵受影响者思想的孢子。当生物在灵光内结束回合且未屏息时，必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:42]豁免。若检定失败，则该生物会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused} ，直至其下一回合结束（或大失败时持续1分钟）

Spawn of Jeharlu.name: 哲哈鲁之嗣 Spawn of Jeharlu
Spawn of Jeharlu.publicNotes:
哲哈鲁之嗣通常在哲哈鲁领域的上空飘荡，满足于沉浸在亵渎且恐怖的梦境与幻想之中，同时监视着下方真菌世界中的入侵者。将哲哈鲁之嗣比作白细胞，虽不算完全贴切，但也相差无几——只不过在这个比喻中，它们所捍卫的身体是哲哈鲁领域本身。当在领域之外遭遇它们时，其角色便会发生逆转——此时它们扮演起感染源的角色，无论走到哪里，都试图通过土壤、植被以及血肉之躯来传播腐化。

源自哲哈鲁孢子FROM JEHARLU SPORES

毁木者将哲哈鲁孢子作为他对抗奇奥尼的首轮攻势，企图以突然且猛烈的方式传播真菌荒疫。而那些被遗弃在外层裂隙中自行萌发的同类孢子，最终会发育成哲哈鲁之嗣。

Camouflage.name: 伪装 Camouflage
Camouflage.description: 扎格拉高尔可以在扭曲棘林的外部环境中@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{躲藏 Hide} ，即使他没有掩蔽.

Old Wound.name: 旧伤 Old Wound
Old Wound.description: 数十年前，祖尔达纳沃克斯几乎咬断扎格拉高尔的右翼，自此该伤口始终未能完全愈合。其右翼基部有一块新月形变色的鳞片区域，正是此伤的疤痕。PC们可能已得知此伤（详见下文处于劣势的扎格拉高尔部分）。否则，则仅当PC目睹对扎格拉高尔造成穿刺伤害的重击时，方可发现这一弱点。一旦PC知晓扎格拉高尔的旧伤，可在其回合中通过@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{搜索 Seek} 瞄准该旧伤。扎格拉高尔被视为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard} ，直至该PC下一回合开始。若PC在以这种方式搜索后同轮内对扎格拉高尔重击，疼痛将使其陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1}与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}状态，持续1小时。若多次重击，可增加状态值，最高至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 4}与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 4}.

Twisting Tail.name: 长尾扭转 Twisting Tail
Twisting Tail.description:
触发 位于龙的尾扫触及范围内的一个生物使用移动动作，或在正在执行的移动动作中离开了一个方格；

效果 龙对该生物进行一次尾扫打击，但承受-2减值。若打击命中，龙打断生物的动作。

Forest Passage.name: 穿林步 Forest Passage
Forest Passage.description: 智角龙忽略任何由植物（如灌木丛、荆棘和矮树丛）造成的困难地形。魔法产生的植物也无法妨碍智角龙的行进。

Impaling Charge.name: 穿刺突袭 Impaling Charge
Impaling Charge.description:
需求 没有生物正被穿在龙角上

效果 龙尝试刺穿敌人。它行走，然后尝试一次角抵打击。命中时，生物被穿到龙角上。被穿串时，生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]状态（可正常尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape}）。龙不需要额外花费动作让被刺穿的生物维持受擒状态。龙会带着受擒生物一同移动。

Spore Breath.name: 孢子龙息 Spore Breath
Spore Breath.description:
扎格拉高尔喷吐出一团毒性孢子云，对@Template[cone|distance:60]内的所有生物造成@Damage[18d6[poison]|options:area-damage]伤害。范围内的生物必须尝试进行一次@Check[fortitude|dc:39|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied]豁免。扎格拉高尔在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spore Breath]]{1d4 rounds}内无法再次使用孢子龙息。

大成功 该生物不受任何伤害。

成功 该生物受到一半伤害

失败 该生物受到全部伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（持续时间无限），因为孢子生根导致受害者产生干扰性幻觉。

大失败 该生物受到双倍伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}（持续时间无限）。

Mist Vision.name: 迷雾视觉 Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: 雾气与浓雾（如迷雾）不会妨碍扎格拉高尔的视觉；他无视雾气造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed} 状态。.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: 在所有对原能的豁免上获得+1状态加值

Miasma.name: 瘴气 Miasma
Miasma.description:
20尺。龙使用毒气龙息后，一团气体毒云从它身上向外弥漫，持续1轮。任何在瘴气中结束回合的生物受到@Damage[5d6[poison]] 伤害 (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] 豁免)。

瘴气中的生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}状态，并视其他生物为状态。智角龙可以看穿这种隐蔽。

Trackless Journey.name: 无踪之旅 Trackless Journey
Trackless Journey.description: 智角龙忽略任何由植物（如灌木丛、荆棘和矮树丛）造成的困难地形。魔法产生的植物也无法妨碍智角龙的行进。

Zauglagaul.name: 扎格拉高尔 Zauglagaul
Zauglagaul.publicNotes:
在原能龙体内循环的魔力会在特定龙种身上表现出更加动物性或兽性的特征。其中最显著的一个例子是智角龙头上的巨大对角。它们庞大的骨架、自然的着色和突出的脊状鳞片各有各的醒目，但智角龙那最显眼的特征，人们会第一眼看到的，仍然是那对角。智角龙会用这对角又快又狠地刺穿猎物，动作尽显力量。在那原始性的外表下，它们通常是沉静的，执着于知识和自律。因此，智角龙一般更乐意与外人交流。

各式各样的龙中不少都具有魔法能力，或是与魔法有所联系。相比之下，一部分龙从魔法中获得的力量更强，因此它们能通过长时间浸淫魔法来施展能力或改变身体性状。随着年龄增长，这些龙变得更加强大，与魔法起源的联系也更为紧密。学者为如何对龙进行分类争论不休，一些人喜欢魔法龙的分类，另一些则根据龙与特定魔法根源的联系而用根源分类龙。不论如何分类，龙都有一些共通的特征：它们能够利用魔力，它们的力量和狡猾会随着年龄增长而成长，以及它们都有囤积大量财宝的习性.
Zauglagaul.allSaves: 在所有对原能的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 status to all saves vs. primal

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
浮陀变为它的束缚区域常见的大型、中型或小型动物。这不会改变它的速度或打击的攻击和伤害调整值，但可能改变打击造成的伤害种类。不论浮陀变为何种形态，它的双脚依旧反扭，也不会投下影子。虽然看上去并不明显，但处于动物形态下的浮陀仍旧是虚体。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Possess Animal.name: 占据动物 Possess Animal
Possess Animal.description: 浮陀尝试占据一只邻接的动物。它们施展升阶到9环级的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]，并有着以下额外效果：因为浮陀没有实体躯体，它们不受法术限制的影响。若动物豁免大失败，法术持续时间延长至1日。在被浮陀占据时，该动物不会投下影子。

Bound.name: 束缚 Bound
Bound.description: 浮陀被束缚在一片它们死亡时所在的自然区域或特定区域，并且离锚点不能超过@Template[emanation|distance:120]{120尺}。浮陀只有在被一位活人旅伴邀请时才能离开此地，它们常常借由诡计获得。在旅行时，浮陀必须保持在至少一个邀请它的活物120尺以内。如果该团体的所有成员死亡，浮陀必须在当天午夜前返回它的束缚之地，否则就被摧毁。

Primal Corruption.name: 原能腐化 Primal Corruption
Primal Corruption.description: 浮陀会腐化它们附近的野生动物，慢慢的侵入动物的思想。居住于浮陀的束缚之地的动物在对抗浮陀的占据动物能力、内在法术@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aIHY2DArKFweIrpf]时获得-4环境减值。

Tanglebriar Bhuta.name: 扭曲棘林浮陀 Tanglebriar Bhuta

Root Rotter.name: 根腐者 Root Rotter

Disperse.name: Disperse
Disperse.description:
Requirements The root rotter has 25 Hit Points or fewer

Effect The root rotter destroys themself. Thorny fungal roots explode from their body, dealing @Damage[10d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save). Any creature who fails the save is exposed to rotter infestation.

Fungus Sense.name: 真菌感知 Fungus Sense
Fungus Sense.description: 根腐者拥有模糊的震颤感知，可探测与它共处真菌地形区域内生物的震动。

Fungal Empowerment.name: 真菌赋能 Fungal Empowerment
Fungal Empowerment.description: 若根腐者在回合开始时接触真菌地形，则恢复@Damage[10[healing]]，且该回合获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened} ；额外动作仅限用于行走或打击。

Fungal Mind.name: 真菌心智 Fungal Mind
Fungal Mind.description: 根腐者彼此可通过心灵感应交流。若至少有一名根腐者在心灵感应范围内，则所有根腐者在先攻骰、察觉检定及对抗心灵效果的豁免检定中获得+2环境加值。若一名根腐者察觉到某名参战者，则所有处于范围内的真菌心智成员均会察觉。

Fungal Root.name: Fungal Root
Fungal Root.description:
Requirements The root rotter is standing in fungal terrain

Effect Fungal roots reach out to snag a nearby foe. An enemy within 30 feet of the root rotter takes @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:27] saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of its next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes clumsy 1 with an unlimited duration. In addition, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} ([[/act escape dc=27]]) for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure but double damage. In addition, the creature is exposed to rotter infestation.

Rotter Infestation.name: Rotter Infestation
Rotter Infestation.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:27]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and can sense the presence of root rotters within 30 feet as an imprecise sense (1 round)

Stage 3 as stage 2, but transformation into a root rotter upon death (1 day)

Root Rotter.publicNotes:
根腐者是绿金镇不幸罹难的精灵居民仅存的残躯。一部分精灵在哲哈鲁孢子最初爆发时便已丧命，而另一部分则被罪孽霉怪侵染。如今，真菌已遍布他们的躯体，缠绕于脑髓与神经之间，驱使着这些行尸走肉再度活动起来。

腐化传播者

若根腐者在某处停留24小时，其周围@Template[type:emanation|distance:5] 范围内将滋生出散发恶臭的令人不悦的真菌，令该区域被菌丝覆盖。此后，根腐者每静止不动额外24小时，真菌的扩散范围便增加5尺；若潜伏不动达12天，扩散范围将扩大至最大@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]。只要存在养分来源，这些真菌便会永久存续，但它们与普通真菌无异，可被轻易摧毁。

Rancorous Priesthood.name: Rancorous Priesthood
Rancorous Priesthood.publicNotes: Followers of Rovagug must usually conceal their devotion to the Rough Beast, hiding in remote cave complexes or abandoned ruins; but they emerge from these strongholds when they sense weakness, gathering together into a destructive, homicidal mob to hunt down high-ranking priests of rival deities or slaughter entire towns. Alternatively, if their hidden bolthole is compromised, a mob of Rovagug's faithful might emerge-not hoping to save themselves, but intent only on taking their enemies with them as they die.

Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description: Whenever the troop Strides, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

Troop Spellcasting.name: Troop Spellcasting
Troop Spellcasting.description:
When the rancorous priesthood Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone.

When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Wild Swing.name: Wild Swing
Wild Swing.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The members of the mob wildly swing their weapons-primarily greataxes-in a chaotic attack at each enemy adjacent to the troop (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d12+2)[slashing]] damage

2 @Damage[(2d12+9)[slashing]] damage

3 @Damage[(3d12+9)[slashing]] damage

Fungal Abomination.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Compression.name: Compression
Compression.description: A fungal abomination can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. While squeezing, it can move at its full speed.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Eat Away.name: Eat Away
Eat Away.description: A creature that begins its turn inside the shoggoth takes @Damage[9d6[acid]] damage.

Maddening Cacophony.name: Maddening Cacophony
Maddening Cacophony.description: 60 feet. A shoggoth constantly voices syllables and mutterings that mortals were not meant to hear. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save or become confused for 1 round ([[/br 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds} on a critical failure). A creature that successfully saves is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.description:
@Damage[(2d10+15)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic]

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

Toxic Sporecloud.name: Toxic Sporecloud
Toxic Sporecloud.description:
10 feet.

Trigger The fungal takes any action on its turn

Effect The fungal abomination exudes a dangerous cloud of spores that fills a ten-foot emanation around it. Each successive round that a fungal abomination activates this spore cloud, the range of the aura extends by 10 feet, to a maximum distance of 60 feet after six rounds of activity. A creature in the aura or that ends their turn in the aura takes @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of their next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of their next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until the end of their next turn.

Fungal Abomination.name: Fungal Abomination
Fungal Abomination.publicNotes:
Although even raving fanatics and doom-saying prophets desperately claim the monstrous shoggoth is nothing more than a drug-induced vision or a thankfully unreal nightmare, the truth is altogether more dire. Shoggoths exist, yet they tend keep to the deepest of ocean trenches or the most remote of caverns and ruins, emerging to spread chaos and destruction in their slimy wakes.

The first shoggoths were created by an alien species to serve as mindless beasts of burden. Their vast bulk, incredible strength, and amorphous nature made them useful slave labor, and their ability to spontaneously form whatever new eyes, mouths, limbs, and other organs they might need made them incredibly versatile. Eventually, the shoggoths developed enough intelligence to rebel against their masters, and now they lurk, patient but potent, in the lightless deeps.

A shoggoth has goals and methods unknowable to humanoid beings. They remember their eons of servitude and, compared to their mysterious masters, humans, elves, dwarves and other intelligent beings are mere specks which crawl upon the surface of the world, indistinguishable from animals. When a shoggoth rolls its immense, hideous body over a band of explorers, engulfing them in a gelatinous press of flesh and gnawing teeth, it is not so much evil as uncaring.

Shoggoths can become the object of worship for humanoid cults dedicated to chaos and entropy. The shoggoth does not respond to this worship, but it can be counted on to consume any hapless victim the cult can capture and sacrifice to it. Rumors of shoggoths that have developed even greater intellects are, one would hope, just that, for the damage a shoggoth capable of reasoning could wreak upon a world is unsettling to say the least.

Fungal Marsh Giant.name: Fungal Marsh Giant

Moldy Mess.name: Moldy Mess
Moldy Mess.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} within the fungal marsh giant's reach

Effect The fungal marsh giant shakes and heaves their body, causing great swaths of mold and fungal crust to slough off them and cover the prone creature. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} in the mold until they [[/act escape dc=27]] and takes @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:27|basic] save). The fungal marsh giant can't use Moldy Mess again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Moldy Mess]]{1d4 rounds}.

Twist the Hook.name: Twist the Hook
Twist the Hook.description: The fungal marsh giant makes a melee Strike with its scythe. If it hits, it twists and yanks the scythe to knock the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and create an awful wound, dealing @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage to the creature.

Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
Spore Cloud.description: 20 feet. The fungal marsh giant exudes a faintly visible cloud of green spores when not underwater. Any creature that ends its turn in the spore cloud takes @Damage[2d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened] save). A creature that fails this save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Fungal Marsh Giant.publicNotes:
Dwellers of brackish coastal salt marshes and fetid bogs and swamps, marsh giants appear hideous to most airbreathers, with fishlike mouths, slimy graygreen skin, and dark, beady eyes. They prefer to eat the flesh of those they slay in battle, including other marsh giants, and guzzle stagnant water from cauldrons or directly from their swampy homes.

Marsh giant clans are insular, with each clan dedicating itself to zealous worship of a sea-dwelling deity, demon lord, or stranger entity. Whatever forces call to the marsh giants sometimes ensnare boggards and ogres as well, gathering in grim worship. Rather than favor these humanoid hangerson, marsh giants lavish attention on favored pets: krooths, giant octopuses, or primeval creatures like dinosaurs and the crocodilian deinosuchuses.

Barely topping 11 feet tall and 1,000 pounds, marsh giants are small for giants but make up for their stature with their zealotry.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

Spore Telepathy.name: Spore Telepathy
Spore Telepathy.description: 60 feet. A crowded veil communicates telepathically via spores. It can communicate telepathically with any creatures who are within its aura.

Crowded Veil Spores.name: Crowded Veil Spores
Crowded Veil Spores.description:
Saving Throw DC 34

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} (1 round)

Stage 4 @Damage[4d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 round)

Spore Trail.name: Spore Trail
Spore Trail.description: A crowded veil shudders, releasing toxic spores. Until the end of their turn, when the clouded veil moves, all spaces they leave are filled with spores. These spore trails persist until the start of the clouded veil's next turn, and can be dispersed immediately by wind in the area. The first time in a round when a creature enters this spore trail, that creature is exposed to crowded veil spores.

One Mind.name: One Mind
One Mind.description: A crowded veil is an individual creature that shares one mind with all other crowded veils. What one crowded veil experiences, all experience. If a crowded veil gains any conditions, all other crowded veils know this; they also know the direction to every other crowded veil and the distances between them. A crowded veil can communicate instantly and telepathically with any other crowded veil on the same planet. To crowded veils located on other planets, messages can take up to an hour or more to transmit. A message to a crowded veil on another plane takes 24 hours to transmit. A crowded veil is immune to mental effects that target only a specific number of creatures. If a mental effect targets all creatures in an area, only the crowded veils in that area are affected, although all other crowded veils sense all damage or conditions endured by those crowded veils.

Crowded Veil.name: Crowded Veil
Crowded Veil.publicNotes:
Only one crowded veil exists, but it does so as separate entities in many different bodies. As each "individual" member shares a core extraplanar essence with the others, communication between them moves without regard to planar boundaries or the limitations of distance, allowing for swift transmission of information throughout Tanglebriar and beyond.

The Many are One

A colony of crowded veil hosts appears unlinked to a casual observer. As intelligent, moving fungi, they can stray far from their clonal siblings, yet cannot move beyond regions that support their growth. On Golarion, this limits the crowded veil to Tanglebriar alone.

Hungry Winds.name: Hungry Winds
Hungry Winds.description: The harpy uses the wind to pull its prey closer. A target within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or be pulled adjacent to the harpy, where they make a jaws Strike against the target. If the target was pulled off the ground and can't fly, it then falls as normal.

Putrid Plague.name: Putrid Plague
Putrid Plague.description:
The sickened and unconscious conditions from putrid plague can't end or be reduced until the disease is cured

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1d4 hours),

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day),

Stage 3 sickened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 day),

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day),

Stage 5 dead

Wind's Whispers.name: Wind's Whispers
Wind's Whispers.description: When a harpy speaks, they can choose one creature within 90 feet. That creature can hear the harpy's words over any other sound, but no other creature hears the words at all.

Gruddunk.name: Gruddunk
Gruddunk.publicNotes:
Harpies are amalgamations of human and bird, resembling feral humans with wings, talons, and sharp teeth. They use their ancestral control of the wind to lure prey or even directly pull in their next meal. They enjoy causing confusion and fear in their prey before they strike, believing it creates a savory flavor in the flesh. Harpies can eat most creatures but strongly prefer sapient prey—humans and elves in particular. Although harpies will eat goblins if sufficiently hungry, they dislike their flavor and avoid eating them if possible. This doesn't comfort goblins, of course, who have a particularly strong fear of harpies.

Because their aeries often reek with the gore of their kills and careless spatters of guano, harpies carry a distinctly vile scent that canny travelers associate with danger. Harpies who roost close to civilization make better efforts to keep clean, though these efforts have mixed results.

Somewhere among the filth, most aeries have a shrine dedicated to the demon lord Pazuzu. Harpy legends credit him with raising them up from simple air spirits to their current station, and their gratitude typically takes the shape of a sketched figure in a corner piled with offerings. More devout families build portable wooden shrines that are carried from aerie to aerie for generations.

Harpies live in family groups or larger clans. Most adults stand 5 feet tall and weigh around 90 pounds. While some use relatively simple weapons, those who master the use of the bow are regarded as heroes among their kind.

Sacrilegious Aura.name: 亵渎灵光 Sacrilegious Aura
Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30尺。当有生物在灵光射程内使用命能法术或能力时，死墓骑士会自动尝试反制它，反制调整值 [[/r 1d20+18 #Counteract]]{+18}.

Weapon Master.description: 死墓骑士无论持用何种武器，均可以使用该武器的重击专精效果。
Weapon Master.name: 武器大师 Weapon Master

Dragon Bonded.name: 龙契之绊 Dragon Bonded
Dragon Bonded.description: 塔利米尔上尉对乌鲁古尔尼克斯的恐怖威压灵光、毒气龙息以及恶臭灵光免疫。如果乌鲁古尔尼克斯被摧毁，塔利米尔上尉会变得愤怒。他在近战打击时会额外造成2点伤害，并且在接下来的3轮内进入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened} 状态；他可以使用该额外动作来行走或打击。

Devastating Blast.name: 毁灭爆震 Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description: 死墓骑士释放出 @Template[cone|distance:30] 的能量。区域内的生物承受 @Damage[12d6[cold]|options:area-damage] 伤害，进行 @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] 豁免。死墓骑士每 [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]] 轮只能使用该能力 1 次。

Graveknight's Curse.name: 死墓骑士诅咒 Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
诅咒会影响任何穿戴死墓骑士护甲超过 1 小时以上的生物。

豁免检定 @Check[will|dc:34] 豁免

潜伏期 1 小时

阶段 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1} 且无法脱下护甲（1 天）

阶段 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}、速度承受 –10 尺状态减值、且无法脱下护甲（1 天）

阶段 3 死亡并转化为护甲的死墓骑士。

Captain Talymir.name: 塔利米尔上尉 Captain Talymir
Captain Talymir.publicNotes: 死墓骑士是由被诅咒的铠甲赋予不死身的亡灵战士。

Create Web Weaponry.name: Create Web Weaponry
Create Web Weaponry.description:
The Leng spider creates a weapon by applying a cord of webbing to heavy objects, such as rocks or chunks of metal, either attaching two heavy objects together to create a web bola or fastening one to its leg to create a web war flail.

Any melee weapon created by a Tanglebriar creeper also becomes saturated with toxin and inflicts an additional 1d6 poison damage on a hit.

Descend on a Web.name: Descend on a Web
Descend on a Web.description:
The Leng spider moves straight down up to 120 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count when calculating falling damage.

The web can be severed by a Strike that deals slashing damage (AC 30, Hardness 15, 25 HP), causing the Leng spider to fall.

Greater Web Sense.name: Greater Web Sense
Greater Web Sense.description: While touching its webs, the Leng spider has precise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Leng Spider Venom.name: Leng Spider Venom
Leng Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round); the confused effect has the emotion and mental traits.

Lay Web Trap.name: Lay Web Trap
Lay Web Trap.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The Leng spider spins a web within 20 feet of itself to create a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TFnr9Gq7VXPJu0GQ]{Grasping Snare}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.a2XaerM1KkPyLIPM]{Stunning Snare}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XU8u9F3uoesGDjgM]{Warning Snare}. The Leng spider's web provides all the raw materials it needs. All save and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DCs associated with web traps use the Leng spider's Crafting DC for traps (DC 43). A web trap decays after 24 hours.

Ranged Trip.name: Ranged Trip
Ranged Trip.description: A Leng spider can use a web bola to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} a target with the Athletics skill. The skill check takes a -2 circumstance penalty. A web bola deals no damage when used to Trip.

Tanglebriar Creeper.name: Tanglebriar Creeper
Tanglebriar Creeper.publicNotes: The monstrous, bloated spiders from the windswept realm of Leng build eerie, dangerous lairs with the aid of magically compelled slaves. Leng spiders have anywhere from five to 13 legs, but never an even number.
Tanglebriar Creeper.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Fungalsense.name: Fungalsense
Fungalsense.description: A spore tyrannosaur in contact with fungal corruption can sense the nearby motion of anything touching the same patch of fungal corruption.

Aura of Spores.name: Aura of Spores
Aura of Spores.description: 30 feet. Creatures that start their turn in the spore tyrannosaurus's aura are in danger of inhaling the toxic spores that it constantly exudes. Creatures without the fungus or plant trait take @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save) upon entering the aura or starting their turn in the aura. Those who fail are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} by the spores.

Fungal Empowerment.name: Fungal Empowerment
Fungal Empowerment.description: While the spore tyrannosaurus is touching fungal corruption, it gains fast healing 10 and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}; it can use the extra action to Stride or Strike.

Fling.name: Fling
Fling.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the tyrannosaurus's jaws

Effect The tyrannosaurus flings the creature into the air up to 10 feet up from its mouth and 20 feet away. The creature falls 25 feet (assuming the tyrannosaurus flings it as high as it can) and takes falling damage accordingly. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage. The creature being landed on can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save.

Pin Prey.name: Pin Prey
Pin Prey.description:
Trigger The tyrannosaurus critically hits a Large or smaller foe with its foot

Effect The creature struck by the foot is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and held in place. As long as the tyrannosaurus doesn't move from its position, the pinned creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

A tyrannosaurus gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack a creature it has pinned in this manner but can only Swallow Whole if that creature is grabbed with its jaws.

Spore Breath.name: Spore Breath
Spore Breath.description: The spore tyrannosaurus unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of highly toxic spores from its maw. Creatures in the area take @Damage[14d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save). Those who fail are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). The fungal tyrannosaurus can't use the spore breath weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge the spore breath weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Spore Tyrannosaurus.name: Spore Tyrannosaurus
Spore Tyrannosaurus.publicNotes:
Widely regarded as the king of the dinosaurs, the tyrannosaurus is a massive predator with a wide mouth filled with viciously sharp teeth. Some tribes of giants have even trained tyrannosauruses as mounts or beasts of war.

Remnants from the world's primeval era, these enormous reptilian animals still exist in large numbers in remote wildernesses or underground in magical Darklands caverns. Lizardfolk, orcs, giants, and other humanoids who live near dinosaurs use the animals as mounts, guards, or hunting beasts. Occasionally, rich nobles will collect dinosaurs to display them in menageries, which almost inevitably leads to cast-offs being nursed back to health by druids and other champions of nature. When dinosaurs establish themselves in regions outside their normal habitats, it's often the result of a large collection being released.

Transpose.name: Transpose
Transpose.description:
The amalgamite chooses up to two destabilized creatures they can see within 50 feet and swaps their positions, or moves a single such creature to an unoccupied space they can see within range. If the amalgamite chooses two creatures, they can choose their self as one of these creatures, but both targets must be the same size.

An unwilling creature can attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save. If either target succeeds at this saving throw, both are unaffected.

If the amalgamite is wrapped in vines when it Transposes with a PC, the amalgamite loses its fly speed and the PC must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The PC isn't gripped by the vines. They either fall or they can cling to the vines and then Climb through them.

Success As critical success, but the PC must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:33] save to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to cling to the vines.

Failure The PC is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the vines until they [[/act escape dc=33]].

Critical Failure As failure, but the PC is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

Destabilizing Field.name: Destabilizing Field
Destabilizing Field.description:
40 feet. A creature that begins its turn within the area feels its body begin to stretch and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or become destabilized. Fungi and plant creatures are not affected.

A destabilized creature emits a 10-foot destabilizing field aura and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. The destabilization ends when the creature is no longer sickened.

A creature that succeeds at its saving throw against the aura is temporarily immune to all destabilizing fields for 1 minute.

Displace.name: Displace
Displace.description:
Trigger The amalgamite is hit by a Strike.

Effect The amalgamite Repositions itself or Transposes itself with another creature. If the amalgamite successfully changes its location, it and any Transposed creature take half damage from the triggering Strike.

Reposition.name: Reposition
Reposition.description: The amalgamite teleports into an unoccupied space it can see within 50 feet.

Fungal Amalgamite.name: Fungal Amalgamite
Fungal Amalgamite.publicNotes:
Teleportation magic can prove a difficult undertaking, even for experienced spellcasters. It requires precise calculation and timing, knowledge of the intended destination, and meticulous control over surging conjuration magics. A mistake in even the most minute element of such a spell can lead to disastrous results for those involved. When a particularly powerful spellcaster makes an error of this kind, either through arrogance or simple misjudgment, they might transform into an amalgamite.

A mass of flesh and misaligned limbs, an amalgamite is the warped body of a former spellcaster, sometimes joined with another version of itself to incorporate additional limbs or other irregularities. They're still alive, but they have become aberrants mentally and physically, with only the vaguest memories of their previous existence, which makes them a dangerous and bewildering foe. Their weird, warped anatomy constantly shifts and regrows, allowing the creatures to shrug off physical blows save those that pierce through its flesh and into its core being.

The magical residue of an amalgamite's creation radiates from it, seeping into and destabilizing any living beings that get too close. Infected creatures then further spread the amalgamite's aura among larger groups of allies and foes alike. The amalgamite uses this power to manipulate and confuse their enemies, whom they can teleport into traps, force into confrontations with other enemies, or draw close into striking range with their own odd appendages.

Burst Cyst.name: Burst Cyst
Burst Cyst.description:
Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled

Trigger A Small or larger creature comes within 10 feet of a rift pulper in its cyst

Effect The rift pulper's cyst explodes, inflicting @Damage[8d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage to all non–rift pulper creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic|options:area-effect] save). The rift pulper emerges from the burst cyst and Strides, Climbs, or Flies once before it rolls Stealth for initiative.

Pulp Quintessence.name: Pulp Quintessence
Pulp Quintessence.description:
The rift pulper rapidly chews on reality itself, gnawing open a short-lived rift into the liminal space between planes in any adjacent square. The rift pulper becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round, and can use the extra action to Stride, Fly, or Strike. If another creature occupies the square in which the rift pulper Pulps Quintessence, it takes @Damage[18d6[bludgeoning]] damage as portions of its body are stretched and distorted painfully by the tear in reality (@Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic] save). The rift pulper can't Pulp Quintessence again for 1 minute.

This ability is more effective in the Outer Sphere, and when used on any of these planes, the rift pulper becomes quickened for 2 rounds, the DC to resist being damaged by the rift increases to @Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic], and the rift pulper can't use Pulp Quintessence again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Pulp Quintessence]]{1d4 rounds}.

Pulp Soul.name: Pulp Soul
Pulp Soul.description: The rift pulper chews on the flesh of a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by it, pulping the quintessence that makes up their soul. The creature takes @Damage[(3d10+10)[spirit]] damage (@Check[will|dc:38|basic] save). If the creature is a native to the outer sphere (such as a celestial or fiend) the damage increases to @Damage[(3d12+12)[spirit]] damage.

Pulper Venom.name: Pulper Venom
Pulper Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round),

Stage 3 enfeebled 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Wood Cyst.name: Wood Cyst
Wood Cyst.description: The rift pulper spends 1 minute digging into a Huge or larger tree or wooden object, then forms a cyst around itself. While inside the cyst, the rift pulper can only sense its surroundings via tremorsense and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until the cyst is broken open. The cyst has AC 40, 50 HP, and shares the rift pulper's weaknesses. If the cyst is broken open by any means other than Burst Cyst, the rift pulper must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}. While inside its cyst, the rift pulper has an automatic result of 49 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as nothing more than a large bulge on the wooden surface.

Rift Pulper.name: Rift Pulper
Rift Pulper.publicNotes:
The rift pulper chews away at the planar structure of reality, eating quintessence to build their hideous hives. These bulbous structures look like partially melted wasp hives with the appearance of distorted faces, arms, and legs pressing against the walls from within.

Cleftwood fiends blend the properties of demons and wood elementals, their timber bodies distorted by burls, rot, and fungal growths. Planar scholars have debated into which category cleftwood fiends are better categorized, but to cleftwoods themselves there is no question—they feel much more at home in the Outer Rifts than they do the Plane of Wood.

Demonic Elementals

Cleftwood fiends aren't true demons or elementals, but they possess both of those creature traits. Since they aren't formed from sinful souls, they lack the typical sin vulnerability most demons possess, and since they possess blood-like sap, they lack the typical immunity to bleed most elementals possess.

Other Cleftwood Fiends

Rift pulpers and second spawn are the only types of cleftwood fiend currently active in Tanglebriar, but others exist in the Outer Rifts, particularly in the realm of Jeharlu. Here, one might encounter the blood-drinking stump-like splintertooth, the humanoid primal-magic-wielding blighted gardener, or the enormous horror of the fell deadfall.

Isqulugia.name: Isqulugia
Isqulugia.description:
Isqulugia's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} conditions can't be removed until this affliction is removed

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 hour)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 paralyzed (1 day)

Stage 5 the creature dies, and its body violently transforms into a new isqulug. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, similar magic, or a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual can return the victim to life. The new isqulug remains even if the victim is brought back to life.

Swamp Stride.description: An isqulug ignores difficult terrain that's caused by typical features of swamps.
Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride

Host Scent.name: Host Scent
Host Scent.description: An isqulug can precisely sense any creature infected with isqulugia within 30 feet, and knows the current stage of the disease.

Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
Spore Cloud.description:
Trigger The Tanglebriar isqulug is hit by a melee attack

Effect The Tanglebriar isqulug unleashes a cloud of toxic spores that burrow into the skin of any living nonfungus creature that is adjacent to them. The spores deal @Damage[2d6[persistent,poison]] damage, and as long as the damage persists, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} from the numbness caused by the spores.

Expel Infestation.name: Expel Infestation
Expel Infestation.description:
The isqulug expels larvae from the hivemind in its head in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[6d10[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage as the swarm feeds on their flesh (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic|options:area-effect] save). Any creature that takes damage is exposed to isqulugia.

The isqulug becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Stupified Duration]]{1d4 rounds}, during which it can't Expel Infestation.

Malleability.name: Malleability
Malleability.description: The isqulug can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} through tight spaces as if it were a Small creature. While Squeezing, it can move at its full Speed. The isqulug can even Squeeze through spaces that typically fit only a Tiny creature, but does so at the standard speed for Squeezing.

Tanglebriar Isqulug.name: Tanglebriar Isqulug
Tanglebriar Isqulug.publicNotes: The isqulug's appearance, though unsettling, might be its least awful aspect. The creature resembles a bipedal amphibian with tentacles instead of arms and a head composed of an undulant mass of what appear to be shifting, slimy transparent eggs filled with writhing larvae. In truth, these larvae constitute the mind and consciousness of the isqulug-its "body" is little more than an organic suit manufactured from the flesh of those it has consumed, analogous to the complex web of a spider or the hive of a colony of bees, but fully capable of movement and violence.

Boggard Cultist.name: Boggard Cultist
Boggard Cultist.publicNotes:
Boggard warriors exalt single combat and prefer to fight alone so that no one can contest their kills. They have been known to pursue enemies who flee combat with a single-mindedness that seems almost supernatural.

Boggards are aggressive humanoid amphibians who thrive in swamps, marshes, and even some rain forests. Boggards hatch from eggs into tadpoles, fiercely competing for food and even consuming their siblings in that struggle. Over 3 years, the surviving boggards develop arms, legs, and lungs while learning the rudiments of hunting, crafts, and warfare—everything needed to survive in their might-makes-right society. At the top of most boggard hierarchies lords a hulking swampseer imbued with sinister divine magic.

Swamp Passage.name: Swamp Passage
Swamp Passage.description: A boggard warrior ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Terrifying Croak.name: Terrifying Croak
Terrifying Croak.description: The boggard warrior unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:36] save; those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description: If the boggard warrior hits a creature with their tongue, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the boggard. Unlike with a normal Grab, the creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the boggard's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 33 and dealing at least 28 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the boggard, it prevents them from using their tongue Strike until they regrow their tongue, which takes a week.

Consuming Resurrection.name: Consuming Resurrection
Consuming Resurrection.description: If the Python dies, he consumes souls stored within his scales and returns to life as if subject to a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual in area C5 of the Amaranthine Oubliette [[/gmr 1d10 #Days]] days later. The Python can't use Consuming Resurrection again for 9 years.

Consume Soul.name: Consume Soul
Consume Soul.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The Python consumes a soul that is trapped in one of his scales or is adjacent to, then gains 150 temporary Hit Points for 1 hour. A soul consumed in this way can only be restored to life by a rank 10 spell, an artifact, or divine intervention.

Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The Python Grabs a creature

Effect The Python uses Swallow Whole.

Snatch Soul.name: Snatch Soul
Snatch Soul.description:
Trigger An adjacent or swallowed creature dies

Effect The Python casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} on the creature.

Soul Scales.name: Soul Scales
Soul Scales.description: The Python can use one of his scales to house a soul he captures with seize soul if that soul is from a creature that is level 22 or lower. When he casts seize soul to transfer such a soul to another vessel or to release it, the scale isn't destroyed. While a scale contains a soul, a screaming face can be seen within it.

Soul Venom.name: Soul Venom
Soul Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:47]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[10d6[spirit]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[12d6[spirit]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[14d6[spirit]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}

Infesting Exhalation.name: Infesting Exhalation
Infesting Exhalation.description: The eshmok exhales a wave of stinging fiendish wasps out in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing @Damage[4d8[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to every creature within the cone (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect] save). The swarming fiend wasps linger in the area for 6 rounds or until the eshmok is able to use Infesting Exhalation again, whichever comes first. Each creature damaged by Infesting Exhalation or that enters the area must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save or take @Damage[2d8[persistent,poison]] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} as the poison renders them dizzy and nauseous. At the end of each of their turns, they can attempt a new Fortitude save to end the effects. The eshmok can't use Infesting Exhalation again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Infesting Exhalation]]{1d6 rounds}.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The eshmok turns into their fungus form or back into their normal humanoid wasp form. In fungus form, they lose their fly Speed and can't make stinger Strikes. In fungus form, they gain a tendril melee Strike (+21 for 2d8+9 slashing plus eshmok infection); the tendril strike has the agile, magical, reach 10 feet, and unholy traits.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Harmony Vulnerability.name: Harmony Vulnerability
Harmony Vulnerability.description: An eshmok's wrathful infestations defines them, and forcing peace upon them wrenches at their soul. If they fail a save against calm or a similar effect forcing them to be peaceful, an eshmok takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage.

Eshmok Infection.name: Eshmok Infection
Eshmok Infection.description:
A creature that's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} by eshmok infection can use the extra action each round for only Strike actions. A creature that's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} by eshmok infection never considers an eshmok in fungal form as a target

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:28]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 confused (1 round)

Stage 2 confused and quickened (1 round)

Stage 3 confused, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and quickened (1 round)

Eshmok.name: Eshmok
Eshmok.publicNotes:
Eshmoks are proof that anger consumes a creature. Formed from wrathful souls, these demons resemble giant humanoid wasps who have fallen victim to parasitic fungi. The fungi's foul-looking fibrous material is a physical manifestation of wrath. Tendrils of it burst from eshmok bodies, emitting rage-inducing spores, while lattices of nest-like growths from their torsos shelter wasplike infestations.

Wrathful Parasites

The swarms that infest an eshmok aren't its allies, but incarnations of anger that serve to constantly harry and agonize the creature. Some maintain that these wasps are manifestations of Calistria's vengeance, but her faithful believe something closer to the truth—that these wasps represent a mockery of vengeance and a corruption of the directed rage their goddess teaches and epitomizes. Eshmoks are particularly reviled by worshipers of Calistria as a result.
Eshmok.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Soul Pod.name: Soul Pod
Soul Pod.disable: @Check[religion|dc:40] three times to exorcise Aravashnial's soul from a pod, or @Check[nature|dc:43] twice to pull the well-hidden filaments that connect the spore pod to the rest of the spires
Soul Pod.hazarddescription: An oblong, puffball-like fungus shaped ominously like a bulging coffin in which Aravashnial's distorted face can be seen silently screaming.
Soul Pod.routine:
(2 actions) The soul pod releases a soulrending shriek on its first action, then on its second action exhales a blast of spore-laden wind in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40]. Creatures in this area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save. This blast has the air and poison traits.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} by the wind.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[16d6[poison]] damage, is knocked prone, and is blown 10 feet backward directly away from the soul pod, possibly being blown off the edge of a platform or stairwell.
Soul Pod.reset: A soul pod deactivates once no PCs are in the spires, then resets automatically.

Soulrending Shriek.name: Soulrending Shriek
Soulrending Shriek.description:
Trigger A round begins after all demons in the spires have been slain

Effect Aravashnial's distorted face unleashes an overwhelming shriek of agony that threatens to completely warp the thoughts of all intruders. All creatures within 20 feet of a soul pod must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure). A confused creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of their turns to end the confusion early. The soul pods then roll initiative.

Spore Burst.description:
Trigger Vintalax takes damage from a melee Strike made by an adjacent creature

Effect Vintalax's corrupted body unleashes a cloud of spores that envelopes the attacker, quickly growing and dissolving their flesh. These spores deal @Damage[4d6[persistent,poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic] save).
Spore Burst.name: Spore Burst

Rotting Gift.name: Rotting Gift
Rotting Gift.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:34]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 stupefied 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 drained 1 and controlled by the Rotting God (1 day)

Stage 5 controlled by the Rotting God (1 day)

Stage 6 the creature becomes permanently controlled by the Rotting God (and may gain unique fungus-themed abilities)—at this point the creature is no longer diseased, and the control can only be ended by the death of the Rotting God or by an effect that removes curses. The creature loses any fungus-themed abilities granted by rotting gift as soon as it's removed.

Spore Breath.name: Spore Breath
Spore Breath.description: Vintalax unleashes a cloud of spores from his mouth in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[12d6[acid]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect] save). Those who fail this save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure) as the spores enter their lungs and begin to grow. These creatures take @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage as long as they remain sickened. This bleed damage cannot be stopped as long as the sickened condition persists. Any creature that takes damage from spore breath is exposed to rotting gift.

Tentacle Eruption.name: Tentacle Eruption
Tentacle Eruption.description: Vintalax drives his tentacles into the ground, causing tendrils of fungus to erupt everywhere in area B9. This deals @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning],3d6[acid]]{2d8 bludgeoning damage plus 3d6 acid} damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save). Creatures that fail their save against tentacle eruption are grasped by the tendrils, reducing their speed by 10 feet until the start of Vintalax's next turn (or are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} on a critical failure).

Otherworldly Will.name: Otherworldly Will
Otherworldly Will.description: Vintalax is driven forward by a singular, otherworldly will, guiding their actions. Whenever Vintalax attempts a Will saving throw against a mental effect that would control or dictate their actions, Vintalax treats the result of the saving throw as one category better.

Throne Tethered.name: Throne Tethered
Throne Tethered.description: Vintalax is attached to his throne by a twisted length of thorny fungal vines that limit his mobility to areas B9 and B10. This tether can be destroyed (AC 30, Hardness 12, HP 50 (BT 25), Immunities acid, bludgeoning; Resistances piercing 10), in which case Vintalax howls in pain as his body rapidly begins to decay. Each round that he remains severed from the throne he loses his fast healing and takes @Damage[4d6[spirit]] damage at the start of his turn, but his AC increases to 36 and his speed to 25 feet, due to his increased mobility. He can end this effect by sitting back down on his throne (an Interact action) and remaining there until the end of his turn, at which point a new fungus tether reattaches to him.

Twisted Loyalties.name: Twisted Loyalties
Twisted Loyalties.description:
Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:33]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls, must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:10] to use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} reaction (3 days)

Stage 2 as stage 1, and +1 status bonus to skill checks, plus must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:10] to heal an ally (1 week)

Stage 3 as stage 2, plus lose sanctification traits (1 week)

Stage 4 anathemas are now edicts, and former edicts are now anathemas—acting upon these new edicts causes loss of abilities and sanctification granted by classes and deities who consider them anathema (1 week)

Veil of Lies.name: Veil of Lies
Veil of Lies.description:
15 feet. A degholau exudes a faint scent of rotting wildflowers in its aura—an odor that dulls the mind. A creature that ends its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Veil of Lies for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} while it remains in the aura and for 10 minutes after leaving the aura.

Critical Failure As failure, except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Conspiratorial Thoughts.name: Conspiratorial Thoughts
Conspiratorial Thoughts.description:
Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:33]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} by the degholau (1 round)

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Exposure Vulnerability.name: Exposure Vulnerability
Exposure Vulnerability.description: The first time each round that a creature critically succeeds at a save against a degholau's Veil of Lies or that a creature confronts the fiend on a falsehood immediately after the demon fails to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie}, the degholau takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Degholau.name: Degholau
Degholau.publicNotes:
Degholaus form from wretched souls who betrayed their societies to evil ends or for personal gain. These fiends resemble bloated, bestial humanoids with eyeless mole-like faces. They have five tails, all of which feature blood-red eyes.

High Crimes

Those whose souls become degholaus abused positions of authority in their nation for personal gain or simply out of a need for cruelty. They might have sold secrets, weakened institutions, or initiated military action against their own people. Some initially deluded themselves into believing their actions were righteous or victimless, but eventually embraced their destructive role, damaging their soul so completely they transform into these demons after their judgment.

Mosquito Aura.name: Mosquito Aura
Mosquito Aura.description:
30 feet. Mosquitoes surround the blight. The mosquitoes ignore creatures the blight designates as allies as well as any who are at full HP. All other creatures who enter the aura or begin their turn within it take @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Putrefied Expulsion.name: Putrefied Expulsion
Putrefied Expulsion.description:
Trigger A creature within 20 feet of the swamp blight deals damage to the blight

Effect The swamp blight violently expels putrefied organic matter at their attacker, making a decaying flesh Strike against them.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: If a blight is slain within its cursed domain, its body melts into the surrounding environment and a new blight of the same type spontaneously forms in [[/gmr 1d10 #Days]] days at the cursed domain's epicenter unless the curse is removed before then. The new blight retains all the memories of the previous blight.

Splatter Viscera.name: Splatter Viscera
Splatter Viscera.description: Targets hit by a decaying flesh Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). This condition is cumulative with itself and with the sickened condition from the mosquito aura, up to a maximum value of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4}. If the Strike critically hits, the target also takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,acid]] damage.

Blight Domination.name: Blight Domination
Blight Domination.description: All blights can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} as an innate primal spell but can target only animals, beasts, fungi, oozes, plants, or undead that are located inside their cursed domain. If a creature dominated by this spell leaves the cursed domain, the effects of dominate immediately end, but as long as the dominated creature remains in the cursed domain, the duration is unlimited. When a blight targets a mindless fungi, ooze, or plant, its dominate spell loses the mental trait.

Call of the Mire.name: Call of the Mire
Call of the Mire.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect An aura of glittering lights surrounds the swamp blight, compelling a target the swamp blight can see that's within 60 feet to move toward it. This is not forced movement and can compel creatures to move through dangerous terrain. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to Call of the Mire for 1 hour.

Success The target immediately Strides or otherwise uses their fastest Speed to approach the swamp blight. This movement does not cost the target their actions. On the target's next turn, they cannot willingly move farther away from the blight, but they can otherwise act normally.

Failure As success, except that the target spends all of their actions on their next turn also approaching the blight if they are not already adjacent, and they cannot take any other actions for 1 round. Additionally, the target cannot willingly move farther away from the blight for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, except that the creature's only actions are to approach the blight for 1 minute.

Cursed Domain.name: Cursed Domain
Cursed Domain.description:
Humanoid creatures that die in a swamp blight's cursed domain are infused with void energy. After 24 hours, they rise as undead creatures of their level of lower. Creatures whose bodies were intact typically become zombies or mummies, while those whose bodies were severely damaged typically rise as shadows or bhutas. These undead are not automatically under the swamp blight's direct control, but they can potentially be dominated by the swamp blight.

Once per year, when in a terrain that is compatible with its type (such as a swamp for a swamp blight), the blight can infuse the land around it with its corrupted essence by performing a rite that takes one day. The region in a 5-mile radius becomes its cursed domain; this effect does not extend into incompatible terrain and does not move with the blight. The point at which the blight cursed the domain becomes its epicenter.

Within their cursed domain, a blight ignores all non-magical difficult terrain and always gains the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SB7cMECVtE06kByk]{Cover Tracks} action. Blights also have an imprecise sense for the locations of all creatures within their domain and can communicate with all sapient creatures they detect within their domain using telepathy. Each blight's cursed domain has additional properties specific to the blight's type. A blight outside of a cursed domain becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until it returns to its own or another blight's cursed domain.

Removing this curse requires a character with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.zGrUu3dUtqHrqGuo]{Break Curse} feat (or a similar ability); this activity must be performed at the cursed domain's epicenter. If the blight that cursed the domain is dead, checks to counteract a cursed domain gain a +4 circumstance bonus.

Oversee Domain.name: Oversee Domain
Oversee Domain.description: The blight projects its senses to any point in its cursed domain, gaining a precise sense of its surroundings with a 500-foot radius until the end of its next turn. A blight can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} through this sensory link. A blight can Sustain this ability, but cannot use it to extend its senses beyond the edges of its domain.

Swamp Blight.name: Swamp Blight
Swamp Blight.publicNotes:
A swamp blight appears as a quivering blob of rancid brown and green mud from which dozens of hateful red eyes peer.

Blights are corruptions of nature's wrath.

Swampy Undead

While a swamp blight can dominate undead in its cursed domain, it prefers to use this power to gather and control undead that would prosper in a swampy environment. When building an encounter with a swamp blight, consider adjusting existing undead to match more thematically with the swampland environment, and avoid using undead that wouldn't make sense in such a region. Adjusting an undead creature's innate spells to be primal spells associated with swampy regions is a great way to achieve this customization.

Favored Host.name: Favored Host
Favored Host.description: Each invidiak has a type of creature they prefer possessing, chosen from aberration, animal, beast, or any humanoid (such as dwarf, elf, or human)—in most cases, the favored type of target is human. When an invidiak casts possession on a favored host, the duration of possession increases to unlimited, and the effect lasts until dispelled or until the invidiak dismisses it.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Exorcism Vulnerability.name: Exorcism Vulnerability
